prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
I apologize for the confusion. This error typically occurs when trying to assign row names that are not unique. So to prevent this error, you should ensure that the row names are unique before assigning them. For gene expression data, there will be rare cases where the gene names could be duplicated, generally though, they're unique or you may want to make sure they are. Here's the corrected code:

```
library("DESeq2")
library("ggplot2")

# Load the count table and annotation
exprs <- read.delim("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", header = TRUE, check.names = FALSE)
row.names(exprs) <- make.names(exprs$Genes, unique = TRUE)  # Ensure unique row names
exprs$Genes <- NULL  # Remove redundant column

colData <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, check.names = FALSE)
row.names(colData) <- make.names(colData[,1], unique = TRUE)  # Ensure unique row names

# Create DESeq2 data sets for each group
ddsList <- lapply(unique(colData$group), function(grp){
  dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData=exprs[,colData$group==grp],
                                colData=colData[colData$group==grp,],
                                design=~LibrarySelection)
  DESeq(dds)
})

# Identify differentially expressed genes in each group
resList <- lapply(ddsList, function(dds){
  results(dds)
})

# Combine results and filter out genes that are not specific for some group
allRes <- do.call(rbind, resList)
grpspecific_genes <- rownames(allRes)[apply(allRes, 1, function(x){
  any(x$padj < 0.05)
})]

# Calculate PCA only using group-specific genes
pcExprs <- log2(exprs[grpspecific_genes,]+1)
pca <- prcomp(t(pcExprs), center = TRUE, scale. = TRUE)

# Create PCA data for plotting
pcaDat <- data.frame(PC1=pca$x[,1], PC2=pca$x[,2], group=colData$group)

# Plot PCA
ggplot(pcaDat, aes(x=PC1, y=PC2, color=group)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_classic()
```
Replace the "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx" and "SRP021193.colData.tsv" with your actual file paths. Note that you will need to replace LibrarySelection with the actual column name from the colData dataframe in the formula inside DESeqDataSetFromMatrix.
